Advisers eligible for this award include your major adviser, college adviser, study abroad adviser, international office adviser, financial aid adviser, EOP Adviser, peer adviser, faculty adviser, etc.
---
The Excellence in Advising Awards Program recognizes exceptional performance and innovation in advising. The nomination cycle for the 2018 Excellence in Advising Awards program is now open.
Nominations can be made by anyone in the campus community including students for exceptional performance in both academic, student affairs, graduate and undergraduate advising.

Award Categories:

  • Outstanding Peer Advisor
  • Outstanding New Advisor (3 years or less advising at UCB)
  • Outstanding Advisor
  • Outstanding Advising Team
  • Outstanding Advising Administrator, Director, Manager, Faculty Advisor or Dean
  • Special Category: The Mary Slakey Howell Award for Excellence in Advising (our highest award for significant contributions to students and the campus-wide advising community)

Awards recognize advising excellence and creativity consistent with the Berkeley vision for advising in that they promote student learning, performance, achievement, engagement, reflection, growth, discovery, wellness, progress and success for all students.

More information on selection criteria and submission guidelines can be found at http://advisingmatters.berkeley.edu/advising-award

Award recipients will be recognized at a formal ceremony and year-end celebration for the entire advising community on December 12th from 4:00 - 6:00 p.m. in the Banatao Auditorium, 310 at Sutardja Dai Hall. 
Questions regarding our awards program can be directed to Elizabeth Wilcox at ewilcox@berkeley.edu.
